intro: Rapuntium puberulum var. glabellum, commonly known as the smooth rapunculus, is a variant of the rapunculus species characterized by its smooth, glabrous surface. It is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically features a short, stout stem with alternate, simple leaves that are often lobed or toothed. Its flowers are usually bright yellow, and it produces small, round fruits known as silique. This variety is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
